DISCLOSURE_INFO:
{
  "Allegations" : "IN MARCH 2002, HERITAGE CAPITAL ADVISORS WAS ENGAGED ON A BEST EFFORTS BASIS TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL ADVISORY SERVICES TO THE BRADLEY FACTOR RELATING TO THE REFINANCING OF A SENIOR DEBT FACILITY. THE WORKING RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN HERITAGE CAPITAL ADVISORS AND THE BRADLEY FACTOR WAS COVERED BY A SIX PAGE ENGAGEMENT AGREEMENT EXECUTED IN MARCH 2002. THE BRADLEY FACTOR IS A RECEIVABLES FACTORING COMPANY BASED IN CLEVELAND, TN. IN SEPTEMBER 2002, THE BRADLEY FACTOR CLOSED ON A REFINANCING TRANSACTION. UPON CLOSING, THE BRADLEY FACTOR DID NOT PAY HERITAGE CAPITAL ADVISORS ITS SUCCESS FEE DUE PURSUANT TO THE ENGAGEMENT AGREEMENT. SHORTLY THEREAFTER, HERITAGE CAPITAL ADVISORS SENT A DEMAND LETTER FOR PAYMENT TO THE BRADLEY FACTOR. ON OCTOBER 10, 2002, IN CHANCERY COURT OF BRADLEY COUNTY, TENNESSEE, THE BRADLEY FACTOR FILED A COMPLAINT AGAINST HERITAGE CAPITAL ADVSORS AND MARK B. FROST ALLEGING BREACH OF CONTRACT, FRAUDULENT AND NEGLIGENT MISREPRESENTATION AND VIOLATION OF THE TENNESSEE CONSUMER PROTECTION ACT. ON NOVEMBER 12, 2002, HERITAGE CAPITAL ADVISORS FILED AN ANSWER AND COUNTERCLAIM. THE MATTER REMAINS AS YET UNRESOLVED AND IN CONTINUING LITIGATION. HERITAGE CAPITAL ADVISORS BELIEVES THAT THE BRADLEY FACTOR'S CLAIMS ARE SPURIOUS AND WITHOUT MERIT AND ARE AN ATTEMPT TO AVOID PAYMENT DUE HERITAGE CAPITAL ADVISORS PURSUANT TO THE ENGAGEMENT AGREEMENT WITH THE BRADLEY FACTOR. ",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$390,000.00",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$30,000.00",

  "Broker Comment" : "IN MARCH 2002, HERITAGE CAPITAL ADVISORS WAS ENGAGED ON A BEST EFFORTS BASIS TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL ADVISORY SERVICES TO THE BRADLEY FACTOR RELATING TO THE REFINANCING OF A SENIOR DEBT FACILITY.  THE WORKING RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN HERITAGE CAPITAL ADVISORS AND THE BRADLEY FACTOR WAS COVERED BY A SIX PAGE ENGAGEMENT AGREEMENT EXECUTED IN MARCH 2002.  IN SEPTEMBER 2002, THE BRADLEY FACTOR CLOSED ON A REFINANCING TRANSACTION. UPON CLOSING, THE BRADLEY FACTOR DID NOT PAY HERITAGE CAPITAL ADVISORS ITS SUCCESS FEE DUE PURSUANT TO THE ENGAGEMENT AGREEMENT.  SHORTLY THEREAFTER, HERITAGE CAPITAL ADVISORS SENT A DEMAND LETTER FOR PAYMENT TO THE BRADLEY FACTOR.  ON OCTOBER 10, 2002, IN CHANCERY COURT OF BRADLEY COUNTY, TENNESSEE, THE BRADLEY FACTOR FILED A COMPLAINT (CASE #02-285) AGAINST HERITAGE CAPITAL ADVISORS AND MARK B. FROST ALLEGING BREACH OF CONTRACT, FRAUDULENT AND NEGLIGENT MISREPRESENTATION, AND VIOLATION OF THE TENNESSEE CONSUMER PROTECTION ACT.  HERITAGE CAPITAL ADVISORS AND MARK B. FROST BELIEVED THAT THE BRADLEY FACTOR’S CLAIMS WERE SPURIOUS AND WITHOUT MERIT AND WERE AN ATTEMPT TO AVOID PAYMENT DUE HERITAGE CAPITAL ADVISORS PURSUANT TO THE ENGAGEMENT AGREEMENT WITH THE BRADLEY FACTOR. ON NOVEMBER 12, 2002, HERITAGE CAPITAL ADVISORS FILED AN ANSWER AND COUNTERCLAIM AS WELL AS A MOTION TO DISMISS.  IN DECEMBER 2002, THE COURT DISMISSED THE BRADLEY FACTOR’S CLAIMS OF BREACH OF CONTRACT.  DEPOSITIONS OF THE BRADLEY FACTOR MANAGEMENT WERE TAKEN ON MARCH 11, 2003.  A TRIAL DATE WAS SET FOR OCTOBER 2, 2003.  ON JULY 23, 2003, A MOTION FOR SUMMARY JUDGEMENT WAS FILED BY HERITAGE CAPITAL ADVISORS AND MARK B. FROST.  ON AUGUST 7, 2003, THE DEPOSITION OF MARK B. FROST WAS TAKEN.  ON THE FOLLOWING DAY OF AUGUST 8, A VERBAL AGREEMENT WAS REACHED BY THE PARTIES FOR SETTLEMENT OF THE MATTER. ON SEPTEMBER 3, 2003, A SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT WAS EXECUTED BY THE PARTIES AND AN ORDER OF DISMISSAL WITH PREJUDICE WAS ENTERED BY THE COURT."
}
